SDG_GOAL: Goal 14: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
SDG_TARGET: Target 14.3: Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 14.3.1: Average marine acidity (pH) measured at agreed suite of representative sampling stations
STAT_CONC_DEF: Ocean acidification is the reduction in the pH of the ocean over an extended period, typically of decades or longer, which is caused primarily by the uptake of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere[1].
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 14: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 14.3: Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 14.3.1: Average marine acidity (pH) measured at agreed suite of representative sampling stations
un_custodian_agency: Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission of United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
